column4: hi there, im trying to install from git, im executing the command git clone http://gnuradio.org/git/gnuradio.git
what am i doing wrong guys ? the command console stays "congelated" waiting for more commands
once you've cloned the source code repository, you'll need to build the program using the included instructions.
maybe i have to wait to clon the code repository ?
perhaps it would be easiest if you used a pastebin to show the commands you typed, and the result.
that looks right. did it not work?
should i put all this commands?
i put the first one and i get the response: Initialized empty Git repository in /home/mario/gnuradio/.git/
i'm guessing you mis-typed that command; double-check it.
it seems it works!! the problem was that i had to wait to clone or download something
thank you very much for your time.
just one last question, where should i look for "usual" commands in ubuntu, i'd like to know the meaning of ./   ./bootstrap and so on...
./bootstrap isn't a linux command per se, just a script to set up the autotools infrastructure needed for the rest of the build.
but, where could i find "the most typical" commands ans scripts ? any web ?
might be best to start here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal
